parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
